title: Boolean Types
text: A boolean data type is declared with the bool keyword and can only take the values true or false.

When the value is returned, true 
= 1 and false 
= 0.
Boolean values are mostly used for conditional testing, which you will learn more about in a later chapter.

examples.heading: Example
examples.code:
bool isCodingFun = true;bool isFishTasty = false;cout << isCodingFun;  
  // Outputs 1 (true)cout << isFishTasty;  // Outputs 0 (false)
